abstract.p: Average individual's retirement plan account grew by 21.5 percent, to $39,966, in year ended June 30 (S)

block.p: Despite a somewhat rocky ride in the stock market this year, Americans have been able to put more money into their retirement plan accounts, a recent survey shows.

The average account has grown by 21.5 percent, to $39,966, in the 12 months ended June 30, according to the survey conducted by PlanSponsor.com, a company that studies pension and retirement issues and publishes PlanSponsor magazine.
Despite a somewhat rocky ride in the stock market this year, Americans have been able to put more money into their retirement plan accounts, a recent survey shows.

The average account has grown by 21.5 percent, to $39,966, in the 12 months ended June 30, according to the survey conducted by PlanSponsor.com, a company that studies pension and retirement issues and publishes PlanSponsor magazine.

Over all, executives of the 71 companies polled said they were responsible for record-keeping of $2.13 trillion in 401(k) assets for 53 million participants, up from $1.67 trillion in assets for 48 million participants in 1999.
